text:
🍃A peaceful river that flows through the Springleaf Nature Park and Park Connector.
🎣Sungei Seletar was damned by Yishun Dam to form what is now Lower Seletar Reservoir.
🪷🪻The calm waters of the river is thriving with plenty of water lilies.
Fun fact
🐠🐐One of the inhabitants of Sungei Seletar is the Orang Seletar.
They originally hunted and fished for a living. But was later engaged in the harvesting of bakau, a mangrove timber.
🌿The area around Sungei Seletar used to be part of Née Soon Village.
Née Soon was named after Lim Née Soon, a prominent rubber merchant and philanthropist.
Née Soon was the Teochew version of Yishun.

Quite a quiet and tranquil place to be for a short slow evening walk.

Saw many people fishing though even though there were many signs prohibiting fishing.

Not a place for long hikes/treks but good enough for a light jog or morning/evening stroll before meals.
Very nice trail along the canal or river.
Very peaceful. Can see so many wild life here

Lovely quite place for a stroll by the river side. Occasionally migratory bird species, can be sighted here as well.Theres a resident eagle here too.But it stays still up on the tall tree canopy, and easily missed by the unsuspecting people below.
